TopicTitle: Solar orbit contract doesn't show target orbit

Articles.Content:
I have a satellite contract for apoapsis 61billion, periapsis 30billion meters, inclination 35.5 degrees. My satellite fulfills the hardware requirements and has escaped Kerbin and is now in solar orbit, but the typical target orbit graphic is absent.

Is there any way to get it to show? Quitting and reloading, going to space center and back, flipping views all did not bring up the target orbit.

I had one of these where the orbit turned out to be very close to the sun - I had to zoom in a long way to see it on the tracking centre screen. I rejected it as I figured the delta-v requirements would be massive.

Edit: hmmm, looking at the wiki, I think an orbit of 35-60 billion metres should be out near Dres.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-09T12:59:02Z" title="03/09/2015 12:59  PM" data-short="9 yr">March 9, 2015</time> by ElWanderer**
Have you tried focusing your view on the sun?
Did you *accept* the contract? The Tracking Station shows orbits and sites for available and accepted contracts but the map view only shows them for accepted ones.

> 
> Have you tried focusing your view on the sun?

> 
> Did you *accept* the contract? The Tracking Station shows orbits and sites for available and accepted contracts but the map view only shows them for accepted ones.

I'd say it's one of these two.
